title: inline trigger on Windows fails due to improper powershell escaping
body:
### Vagrant version
Vagrant 2.2.0

### Host operating system
Windows 10.

### Guest operating system
Windows 2016.

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
  config.trigger.after :up do |trigger|
    trigger.only_on = ['ubuntu', 'windows', 'macos']
    trigger.run = {inline: "vagrant ssh -c 'cat /vagrant/tmp/*.ssh_known_hosts | sudo tee /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts' jenkins"}
  end
```

### Debug output

```
==> windows: Running triggers after up ...
==> windows: Running trigger...
    windows: Running local: Inline script
    windows: vagrant ssh -c 'cat /vagrant/tmp/*.ssh_known_hosts | sudo tee /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts' jenkins
XXX trigger exec_method #<Method: Vagrant::Util::PowerShell.execute_inline>
XXX trigger cmd ["vagrant", "ssh", "-c", "cat /vagrant/tmp/*.ssh_known_hosts | sudo tee /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts", "jenkins"]
XXX execute_inline c ["powershell", "-NoLogo", "-NoProfile", "-NonInteractive", "-ExecutionPolicy", "Bypass", "-Command", "vagrant ssh -c cat /vagrant/tmp/*.ssh_known_hosts | sudo tee /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts jenkins", {:notify=>[:stdout, :stderr]}]
    windows: sudo : The term 'sudo' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included,
    windows: verify that the path is correct and try again.
    windows: At line:1 char:53
    windows: + vagrant ssh -c cat /vagrant/tmp/*.ssh_known_hosts | sudo tee /etc/ssh ...
    windows: +                                                     ~~~~
    windows:     + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (sudo:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
    windows:     + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException
    windows:
==> windows: Trigger run failed
==> windows: A script exited with an unacceptable exit code 1.
A script exited with an unacceptable exit code 1.
```

Those `XXX` were placed by me inside the corresponding vagrant source code so I could see what was going on.

As you can see, it was supposed to execute:

 `vagrant ssh -c 'cat /vagrant/tmp/*.ssh_known_hosts | sudo tee /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts' jenkins`

as translated by `Shellwords.split` to the ruby array:

 `["vagrant", "ssh", "-c", "cat /vagrant/tmp/*.ssh_known_hosts | sudo tee /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts", "jenkins"]`

Which, by accident, ended up being correctly parsed. But it could not have been, because vagrant trigger is using `Shellwords.split` which is a function that is expected to split a unix shell command line and not a windows command line:

https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/blob/5daa25db806f15e8150e57f5c9292c56cc2f5e95/lib/vagrant/plugin/v2/trigger.rb#L159-L164

After that first parsing, vagrant trigger incorrectly constructs the command line by just joining the arguments with a  space:

https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/blob/5daa25db806f15e8150e57f5c9292c56cc2f5e95/lib/vagrant/util/powershell.rb#L119-L136

and that ends up executing the incorrectly constructed command line:

`["powershell", "-NoLogo", "-NoProfile", "-NonInteractive", "-ExecutionPolicy", "Bypass", "-Command", "vagrant ssh -c cat /vagrant/tmp/*.ssh_known_hosts | sudo tee /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts jenkins"]`

due to the missing single-quotes in the `-c` argument value.

As a workaround, I was able to create the command line by escaping the arguments with:

```ruby
        # escape single quotes with another single quote.
        command = command.map{|arg| "'#{arg.to_s.gsub("'", "''")}'"}.join ' '

        c = [
          executable,
          "-NoLogo",
          "-NoProfile",
          "-NonInteractive",
          "-ExecutionPolicy", "Bypass",
          "-Command",
          "#{env}&#{command}" # AND by adding an & in here
        ].flatten.compact
```

In sum, vagrant triggers should be modified to use a proper windows command line parsing function and it should properly create a command line by escaping all the arguments.
